text: Resolution 2250 (2015)
Adopted by the Security Council at its 7573rd meeting, on
9 December 2015
The Security Council,

Recalling its resolutions 1325 (2000), 1820 (2008), 1889 (2009), 1960 (2010), 2106 (2013), 2122 (2013) and 2242 (2015) on Women, Peace and Security and all relevant statements of its President, its resolutions on Countering Terrorism 2178 (2014) and 2195 (2014) and the Statement of its President S/PRST/2015/11, and the Statements of its President on Post-Conflict Peacebuilding S/PRST/2012/29 and S/PRST/2015/2,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolutions 1325 (2000), 1820 (2008), 1889 (2009), 1960 (2010), 2106 (2013), 2122 (2013) and 2242 (2015) on Women, Peace and Security and all relevant statements of {{its President}}, its resolutions on Countering Terrorism 2178 (2014) and 2195 (2014) and the Statement of {{its President}} S/PRST/2015/11, and the Statements of {{its President}} on Post-Conflict Peacebuilding S/PRST/2012/29 and S/PRST/2015/2,
uncertainties: The referenced entity is the President of the Security Council, which is not listed explicitly; normalized as 'SC President' and classified as 'other'.

text: Recalling its resolutions 1265 (1999) and 1894 (2009) on the Protection of Civilians in Armed Conflict,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolutions 1265 (1999) and 1894 (2009) on the Protection of Civilians in Armed Conflict,

text: Bearing in mind the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations and the primary responsibility of the Security Council under the Charter for the maintenance of international peace and security,
textWithHighlights: *Bearing in mind* the purposes and principles of the Charter of the {{United Nations}} and the primary responsibility of the {{Security Council}} under the Charter for the maintenance of international peace and security,

text: Noting that the term youth is defined in the context of this resolution as persons of the age of 18-29 years old, and further noting the variations of definition of the term that may exist on the national and international levels, including the definition of youth in the General Assembly resolutions A/RES/50/81 and A/RES/56/117,
textWithHighlights: *Noting* that the term youth is defined in the context of this resolution as persons of the age of 18-29 years old, and *further noting* the variations of definition of the term that may exist on the national and international levels, including the definition of youth in the {{General Assembly}} resolutions A/RES/50/81 and A/RES/56/117,

text: Recognizing that today’s generation of youth is the largest the world has ever known and that young people often form the majority of the population of countries affected by armed conflict,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that today’s generation of youth is the largest the world has ever known and that young people often form the majority of the population of countries affected by armed conflict,

text: Expressing concern that among civilians, youth account for many of those adversely affected by armed conflict, including as refugees and internally displaced persons, and that the disruption of youth’s access to education and economic opportunities has a dramatic impact on durable peace and reconciliation,
textWithHighlights: *Expressing concern* that among civilians, youth account for many of those adversely affected by armed conflict, including as refugees and internally displaced persons, and that the disruption of youth’s access to education and economic opportunities has a dramatic impact on durable peace and reconciliation,

text: Recognizing the important and positive contribution of youth in efforts for the maintenance and promotion of peace and security,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* the important and positive contribution of youth in efforts for the maintenance and promotion of peace and security,

text: Reissued for technical reasons on 5 January 2016.
textWithHighlights: Reissued for technical reasons on 5 January 2016.
uncertainties: This appears to be an editorial/technical note rather than a preambular or operative paragraph; no operative verbs, assignees, or deliverables to extract.

text: Affirming the important role youth can play in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and as a key aspect of the sustainability, inclusiveness and success of peacekeeping and peacebuilding efforts,
textWithHighlights: *Affirming* the important role youth can play in the prevention and resolution of conflicts and as a key aspect of the sustainability, inclusiveness and success of peacekeeping and peacebuilding efforts,
uncertainties: The verb 'affirming' is not listed in the provided exhaustive list of operative verbs; treated here as a reinforcing preambular verb with normalized action set to null.

text: Recognizing that youth should actively be engaged in shaping lasting peace and contributing to justice and reconciliation, and that a large youth population presents a unique demographic dividend that can contribute to lasting peace and economic prosperity if inclusive policies are in place,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that youth should actively be engaged in shaping lasting peace and contributing to justice and reconciliation, and that a large youth population presents a unique demographic dividend that can contribute to lasting peace and economic prosperity if inclusive policies are in place,

text: Recognizing that the rise of radicalization to violence and violent extremism, especially among youth, threatens stability and development, and can often derail peacebuilding efforts and foment conflict, and stressing the importance of addressing conditions and factors leading to the rise of radicalization to violence and violent extremism among youth, which can be conducive to terrorism,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that the rise of radicalization to violence and violent extremism, especially among youth, threatens stability and development, and can often derail peacebuilding efforts and foment conflict, and *stressing* the importance of addressing conditions and factors leading to the rise of radicalization to violence and violent extremism among youth, which can be conducive to terrorism,

text: Expressing concern over the increased use, in a globalized society, by terrorists and their supporters of new information and communication technologies, in particular the Internet, for the purposes of recruitment and incitement of youth to commit terrorist acts, as well as for the financing, planning and preparation of their activities, and underlining the need for Member States to act cooperatively to prevent terrorists from exploiting technology, communications and resources to incite support for terrorist acts, while respecting human rights and fundamental freedoms and in compliance with other obligations under international law,
textWithHighlights: *Expressing concern* over the increased use, in a globalized society, by terrorists and their supporters of new information and communication technologies, in particular the Internet, for the purposes of recruitment and incitement of youth to commit terrorist acts, as well as for the financing, planning and preparation of their activities, and *underlining* the need for {{Member States}} to act cooperatively to prevent terrorists from exploiting technology, communications and resources to incite support for terrorist acts, while respecting human rights and fundamental freedoms and in compliance with other obligations under international law,

text: Noting the important role youth can play further as positive role models in preventing and countering violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, and fuels conflict, inhibits socioeconomic development and fosters regional and international insecurity,
textWithHighlights: *Noting* the important role youth can play further as positive role models in preventing and countering violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, and fuels conflict, inhibits socioeconomic development and fosters regional and international insecurity,

text: Noting that the Secretary-General is finalizing a Plan of Action to Prevent Violent Extremism to integrate youth’s participation, leadership and empowerment as core to the United Nations strategy and responses,
textWithHighlights: *Noting* that the {{Secretary-General}} is finalizing a Plan of Action to Prevent Violent Extremism to integrate youth’s participation, leadership and empowerment as core to the {{United Nations}} strategy and responses,

text: Noting the World Programme of Action for Youth, the Guiding Principles on Young People’s Participation in Peacebuilding, the August 2015 Global Forum on Youth, Peace and Security, the Amman Declaration on Youth, Peace and Security, the September 2015 Global Youth Summit against Violent Extremism and the Action Agenda to Prevent Violent Extremism and Promote Peace, and acknowledging their role in creating a foundation that promotes young people’s inclusive participation and positive contribution to building peace in conflict and post-conflict situations,
textWithHighlights: *Noting* the World Programme of Action for Youth, the Guiding Principles on Young People’s Participation in Peacebuilding, the August 2015 Global Forum on Youth, Peace and Security, the Amman Declaration on Youth, Peace and Security, the September 2015 Global Youth Summit against Violent Extremism and the Action Agenda to Prevent Violent Extremism and Promote Peace, and *acknowledging* their role in creating a foundation that promotes young people’s inclusive participation and positive contribution to building peace in conflict and post-conflict situations,
uncertainties: The paragraph references various programmes, declarations and events, which are documents/events rather than organizations; thus they were not treated as mentioned entities.

text: Acknowledging the on-going work of national governments and regional and international organisations to engage youth in building and maintaining peace,
textWithHighlights: *Acknowledging* the on-going work of {{national governments}} and {{regional}} and {{international organisations}} to engage youth in building and maintaining peace,

text: Encouraging Member States to consider developing a UN common approach to inclusive development as a key for preventing conflict and enabling long-term stability and sustainable peace, and highlighting in this regard the importance of identifying and addressing social, economic, political, cultural and religious exclusion, intolerance, as well as violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, as drivers of conflict,
textWithHighlights: *Encouraging* {{Member States}} to consider developing a {{UN}} common approach to inclusive development as a key for preventing conflict and enabling long-term stability and sustainable peace, and *highlighting* in this regard the importance of identifying and addressing social, economic, political, cultural and religious exclusion, intolerance, as well as violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, as drivers of conflict,
uncertainties: This is a preambular paragraph; therefore no assignees or deliverables were extracted even though it references Member States and a potential UN common approach.

text: Recognizing that the protection of youth during conflict and post-conflict and their participation in peace processes can significantly contribute to the maintenance and promotion of international peace and security, and being convinced that the protection of civilians, including youth, in armed conflict should be an important aspect of any comprehensive strategy to resolve conflict and build peace,
textWithHighlights: *Recognizing* that the protection of youth during conflict and post-conflict and their participation in peace processes can significantly contribute to the maintenance and promotion of international peace and security, and being convinced that the protection of civilians, including youth, in armed conflict should be an important aspect of any comprehensive strategy to resolve conflict and build peace,
uncertainties: The phrase "being convinced" is not in the provided list of operative verbs; therefore only "Recognizing" is treated as the operative (observing) verb for this preambular paragraph.

text: Noting relevant provisions of the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court,
textWithHighlights: *Noting* relevant provisions of the Rome Statute of the {{International Criminal Court}},

text: Participation

Urges Member States to consider ways to increase inclusive representation of youth in decision-making at all levels in local, national, regional and international institutions and mechanisms for the prevention and resolution of conflict, including institutions and mechanisms to counter violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, and, as appropriate, to consider establishing integrated mechanisms for meaningful participation of youth in peace processes and dispute-resolution;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Integrated mechanisms for youth participation in peace processes

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to consider ways to increase inclusive representation of youth in decision-making at all levels in local, national, regional and international institutions and mechanisms for the prevention and resolution of conflict, including institutions and mechanisms to counter violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, and, as appropriate, to consider establishing [[integrated mechanisms]] for meaningful participation of youth in peace processes and dispute-resolution;
uncertainties: The deliverable "integrated mechanisms" could arguably fall under policy or infrastructure; classified here as policy since the mechanisms are institutional rather than physical.

text: Calls on all relevant actors, including when negotiating and implementing peace agreements, to take into account, as appropriate, the participation and views of youth, recognising that their marginalisation is detrimental to building sustainable peace in all societies, including, inter alia, such specific aspects as:
textWithHighlights: *Calls on* all relevant actors, including when negotiating and implementing peace agreements, to take into account, as appropriate, the participation and views of youth, recognising that their marginalisation is detrimental to building sustainable peace in all societies, including, inter alia, such specific aspects as:
uncertainties: "all relevant actors" is too vague to be treated as a concrete assignee; no specific deliverable is stated beyond a general consideration of youth participation.

text: The needs of youth during repatriation and resettlement and for rehabilitation, reintegration and post-conflict reconstruction;
textWithHighlights: The needs of youth during repatriation and resettlement and for rehabilitation, reintegration and post-conflict reconstruction;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the directive "Calls on" and the assignee "all relevant actors" from the parent clause. It lists aspects to consider rather than a concrete task, so no deliverable was extracted.

text: Measures that support local youth peace initiatives and indigenous processes for conflict resolution, and that involve youth in the implementation mechanisms of peace agreements;
textWithHighlights: Measures that support local youth peace initiatives and indigenous processes for conflict resolution, and that involve youth in the implementation mechanisms of peace agreements;
uncertainties: This subparagraph appears to inherit the operative verb from the parent clause: 'Calls on all relevant actors ... such specific aspects as:'. 'All relevant actors' is too vague to list as an assignee. The items listed are aspects to consider rather than concrete deliverables.

text: Measures to empower youth in peacebuilding and conflict resolution;
textWithHighlights: Measures to empower youth in peacebuilding and conflict resolution;
uncertainties: This subparagraph appears to inherit the directive 'Calls on all relevant actors ...' from the parent clause. No concrete deliverable is specified in this line, and the assignee ('all relevant actors') does not appear in the subparagraph text, so no assignee is recorded here.

text: Stresses the importance of Security Council missions taking into account youth-related considerations including, as appropriate, through consultation with local and international youth groups;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of {{Security Council}} missions taking into account youth-related considerations including, as appropriate, through consultation with local and international {{youth groups}};
uncertainties: No directive or concrete task is assigned; classified “youth groups” as civil society for mentioned entities.

text: Protection

Calls upon all parties to armed conflict to comply strictly with the obligations applicable to them under international law relevant to the protection of civilians, including those who are youth, including the obligations applicable to them under the Geneva Conventions of 1949 and the Additional Protocols thereto of 1977;
textWithHighlights: *Calls upon* <<all parties to armed conflict>> to comply strictly with the obligations applicable to them under international law relevant to the protection of civilians, including those who are youth, including the obligations applicable to them under the Geneva Conventions of 1949 and the Additional Protocols thereto of 1977;

text: Further calls upon states to comply with the obligations applicable to them under the 1951 Convention Relating to the Status of Refugee and the Protocol thereto of 1967, the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women of 1979 and the Optional Protocol thereto of 1999 and the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities;
textWithHighlights: Further *calls upon* <<states>> to comply with the obligations applicable to them under the 1951 Convention Relating to the Status of Refugee and the Protocol thereto of 1967, the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women of 1979 and the Optional Protocol thereto of 1999 and the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities;
uncertainties: Considered whether to mark 'comply with the obligations' as a deliverable; opted not to, as compliance is a general directive rather than a concrete deliverable per the categories.

text: Further calls upon Member States to comply with their respective obligations to end impunity and further calls on them to investigate and prosecute those responsible for genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes and other egregious crimes perpetrated against civilians, including youth, noting that the fight against impunity for the most serious crimes of international concern has been strengthened through the work on and prosecution of these crimes by the International Criminal Court, ad hoc and mixed tribunals and specialized chambers in national tribunals;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Investigations and prosecutions of serious international crimes against civilians

textWithHighlights: *Further calls upon* <<Member States>> to comply with their respective obligations to end impunity and *further calls on* <<them>> to [[investigate and prosecute]] those responsible for genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes and other egregious crimes perpetrated against civilians, including youth, noting that the fight against impunity for the most serious crimes of international concern has been strengthened through the work on and prosecution of these crimes by the {{International Criminal Court}}, {{ad hoc and mixed tribunals}} and {{specialized chambers in national tribunals}};
uncertainties: Deliverable category for “prosecute” does not match any enumerated type; grouped with “investigate” under analysis. “Comply with obligations to end impunity” was treated as too vague to extract as a deliverable.

text: Calls on all parties to armed conflict to take the necessary measures to protect civilians, including those who are youth, from all forms of sexual and gender-based violence;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Protection of civilians from sexual and gender-based violence

textWithHighlights: *Calls on* <<all parties to armed conflict>> to take the necessary measures to [[protect civilians]], including those who are youth, from all forms of sexual and gender-based violence;
uncertainties: Mapped 'protect civilians from sexual and gender-based violence' to deliverable type 'humanitarian_assistance' as the closest fit, though it could also be seen as a protection mandate not perfectly captured by the categories.

text: Reaffirms that states must respect and ensure the human rights of all individuals, including youth, within their territory and subject to their jurisdiction as provided for by relevant international law and reaffirms that each state bears the primary responsibility to protect its populations from genocide, war crimes, ethnic cleansing, and crimes against humanity;
textWithHighlights: *Reaffirms* that <<states>> must respect and ensure the human rights of all individuals, including youth, within their territory and subject to their jurisdiction as provided for by relevant international law and *reaffirms* that <<each state>> bears the primary responsibility to protect its populations from genocide, war crimes, ethnic cleansing, and crimes against humanity;

text: Urges Member States to consider specific measures, in conformity with international law, that ensure, during armed conflict and post conflict, the protection of civilians, including youth;
textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to consider specific measures, in conformity with international law, that ensure, during armed conflict and post conflict, the protection of civilians, including youth;
uncertainties: No concrete deliverable extracted; 'consider specific measures' is too vague to classify as a specific deliverable.

text: Prevention

Urges Members States to facilitate an inclusive and enabling environment in which youth actors, including youth from different backgrounds, are recognised and provided with adequate support to implement violence prevention activities and support social cohesion;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: inclusive and enabling environment for youth actors

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Members States>> to facilitate an [[inclusive and enabling environment]] in which youth actors, including youth from different backgrounds, are recognised and provided with adequate support to implement violence prevention activities and support social cohesion;
uncertainties: Deliverables beyond the policy-level 'inclusive and enabling environment' (e.g., 'adequate support') are vague and not classified into a specific resource/support category.

text: Stresses the importance of creating policies for youth that would positively contribute to peacebuilding efforts, including social and economic development, supporting projects designed to grow local economies, and provide youth employment opportunities and vocational training, fostering their education, and promoting youth entrepreneurship and constructive political engagement;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the importance of creating policies for youth that would positively contribute to peacebuilding efforts, including social and economic development, supporting projects designed to grow local economies, and provide youth employment opportunities and vocational training, fostering their education, and promoting youth entrepreneurship and constructive political engagement;

text: Urges Member States to support, as appropriate, quality education for peace that equips youth with the ability to engage constructively in civic structures and inclusive political processes;
textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to support, as appropriate, quality education for peace that equips youth with the ability to engage constructively in civic structures and inclusive political processes;
uncertainties: Considered whether "quality education for peace" could be a deliverable (capacity_building), but treated as too general/aspirational to extract as a concrete deliverable.

text: Calls on all relevant actors to consider instituting mechanisms to promote a culture of peace, tolerance, intercultural and interreligious dialogue that involve youth and discourage their participation in acts of violence, terrorism, xenophobia, and all forms of discrimination;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Mechanisms to promote a culture of peace, tolerance, and intercultural and interreligious dialogue

textWithHighlights: *Calls on* all relevant actors to consider instituting [[mechanisms]] to promote a culture of peace, tolerance, intercultural and interreligious dialogue that involve youth and discourage their participation in acts of violence, terrorism, xenophobia, and all forms of discrimination;
uncertainties: "all relevant actors" is too vague to treat as a concrete assignee, so none is recorded. The deliverable "mechanisms" is somewhat generic; classified under policy as institutional mechanisms/frameworks.

text: Partnerships

Urges Member States to increase, as appropriate, their political, financial, technical and logistical support, that take account of the needs and participation of youth in peace efforts, in conflict and post-conflict situations, including those undertaken by relevant entities, funds and programmes, inter alia, the United Nations Peacebuilding Support Office, United Nations Peacebuilding fund, United Nations Development Programme, United Nations Population Fund, UN-Women, and by the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights, the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime and other relevant bodies, and actors at regional and international levels;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights
United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime

textWithHighlights: *Urges* <<Member States>> to increase, as appropriate, their political, financial, technical and logistical support, that take account of the needs and participation of youth in peace efforts, in conflict and post-conflict situations, including those undertaken by relevant entities, {{funds}} and {{programmes}}, inter alia, the {{United Nations Peacebuilding Support Office}}, {{United Nations Peacebuilding fund}}, {{United Nations Development Programme}}, {{United Nations Population Fund}}, {{UN-Women}}, and by the {{Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees}}, the {{Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights}}, the {{United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime}} and other relevant bodies, and actors at regional and international levels;
uncertainties: Considered but did not extract deliverables (e.g., increasing political/financial/technical/logistical support) as concrete deliverables, to remain conservative. Mapped 'United Nations Peacebuilding Support Office' to 'UN Secretariat' and 'United Nations Peacebuilding fund' to 'UN funds' due to lack of specific entries in the provided list.

text: Stresses the vital role the Peacebuilding Commission in addressing the conditions and factors leading to the rise of radicalization to violence and violent extremism among youth, which can be conducive to terrorism, by including in its advice and recommendations for peace building strategies ways to engage youth meaningfully during and in the aftermath of armed conflict;
textWithHighlights: *Stresses* the vital role the {{Peacebuilding Commission}} in addressing the conditions and factors leading to the rise of radicalization to violence and violent extremism among youth, which can be conducive to terrorism, by including in its advice and recommendations for peace building strategies ways to engage youth meaningfully during and in the aftermath of armed conflict;
uncertainties: Peacebuilding Commission is not explicitly listed in the provided entity list; mapped as a UN Organ under 'Other (Other United Nations Bodies)' and treated as a mentioned entity rather than an assignee since no directive is given.

text: Encourages Member States to engage relevant local communities and non-governmental actors in developing strategies to counter the violent extremist narrative that can incite terrorist acts, address the conditions conducive to the spread of violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, including by empowering youth, families, women, religious, cultural and education leaders, and all other concerned groups of civil society and adopt tailored approaches to countering recruitment to this kind of violent extremism and promoting social inclusion and cohesion;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Strategies to counter violent extremist narrative
Empowerment of youth, families, women, religious, cultural and education leaders
Tailored approaches to counter recruitment and promote social inclusion and cohesion

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<Member States>> to engage relevant {{local communities}} and {{non-governmental actors}} in [[developing strategies]] to counter the violent extremist narrative that can incite terrorist acts, address the conditions conducive to the spread of violent extremism, which can be conducive to terrorism, including by [[empowering]] {{youth}}, {{families}}, {{women}}, {{religious, cultural and education leaders}}, and all other concerned groups of {{civil society}} and [[adopt tailored approaches]] to countering recruitment to this kind of violent extremism and promoting social inclusion and cohesion;
uncertainties: Whether "empowering" should be considered a concrete deliverable (capacity-building) or treated as aspirational; mapping "non-governmental actors" to "non-governmental organizations" for normalization may be broader than intended.

text: Disengagement & reintegration

Encourages all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration to consider the needs of youth affected by armed conflict, including, inter alia, such specific aspects as:

assignees.assignee: all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration

textWithHighlights: *Encourages* <<all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration>> to consider the needs of youth affected by armed conflict, including, inter alia, such specific aspects as:
uncertainties: Assignee is broad and not a standard listed entity; normalized as 'DDR planners'. No concrete deliverable identified since 'consider the needs' is not a specific actionable output.

text: evidence-based and gender-sensitive youth employment opportunities, inclusive labour policies, national youth employment action plans in partnership with the private sector, developed in partnership with youth and recognising the interrelated role of education, employment and training in preventing the marginalisation of youth;

assignees.assignee: all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration

textWithHighlights: evidence-based and gender-sensitive youth employment opportunities, inclusive labour policies, national youth employment action plans in partnership with the {{private sector}}, developed in partnership with youth and recognising the interrelated role of education, employment and training in preventing the marginalisation of youth;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent. The listed items read as aspects to consider rather than concrete tasks; therefore, no deliverables were extracted.

text: investment in building young persons’ capabilities and skills to meet labour demands through relevant education opportunities designed in a manner which promotes a culture of peace;

assignees.assignee: all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration

textWithHighlights: [[investment]] in building young persons’ capabilities and skills to meet labour demands through relevant education opportunities designed in a manner which promotes a culture of peace;
uncertainties: This is a subparagraph inheriting 'Encourages' and the assignee from the parent. The deliverable could alternatively be categorized as 'capacity_building' (building capabilities/skills) rather than 'financial_resources' (investment).

text: support for youth-led and peacebuilding organisations as partners in youth employment and entrepreneurship programs;

assignees.assignee: all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: support for youth-led and peacebuilding organizations as partners in youth employment and entrepreneurship programs

textWithHighlights: [[support]] for youth-led and peacebuilding organisations as partners in youth employment and entrepreneurship programs;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb and assignee from the parent clause (“Encourages all those involved in the planning for disarmament, demobilization and reintegration…”). The deliverable is interpreted as providing support, though the text frames it as an aspect to consider rather than an explicit instruction to deliver support; deliverable type could alternatively be classified as financial_resources depending on the broader context.

text: Notes its readiness, whenever measures are adopted under Article 41 of the Charter of the United Nations, to consider their potential impact on the population, including youth;
textWithHighlights: *Notes* its readiness, whenever measures are adopted under Article 41 of the Charter of the {{United Nations}}, to consider their potential impact on the population, including youth;
uncertainties: Marked 'United Nations' as a mentioned entity although it appears as part of the treaty name ('Charter of the United Nations'). No concrete deliverable identified from 'readiness to consider'.

text: Next steps

Invites relevant entities of the United Nations, Rapporteurs and Special Envoys and Representatives of the Secretary-General, including the Secretary-General’s Envoy on Youth and the Special Envoy for Youth Refugees, to improve the coordination and interaction regarding the needs of youth during armed conflicts and post-conflict situations;

assignees.assignee: relevant entities of the United Nations

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Improve coordination and interaction on youth needs in conflict and post-conflict

textWithHighlights: *Invites* <<relevant entities of the United Nations>>, <<Rapporteurs>> and <<Special Envoys>> and <<Representatives of the Secretary-General>>, including the <<Secretary-General’s Envoy on Youth>> and the <<Special Envoy for Youth Refugees>>, to [[improve the coordination and interaction]] regarding the needs of youth during armed conflicts and post-conflict situations;
uncertainties: "Rapporteurs" are not a standard entity in the list; treated as an "other" assignee. "Special Envoy for Youth Refugees" may not correspond to a formally established post; treated as a UN Secretariat envoy. Deliverable type mapped to "information_sharing" as the closest fit to coordination/interaction.

text: Requests the Secretary-General to carry out a progress study on the youth’s positive contribution to peace processes and conflict resolution, in order to recommend effective responses at local, national, regional and international levels, and further requests the Secretary-General to make the results of this study available to the Security Council and all Member States of the United Nations;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: progress study on youth’s contributions to peace processes and conflict resolution
recommendations on effective responses at local, national, regional and international levels

textWithHighlights: *Requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to carry out a [[progress study]] on the youth’s positive contribution to peace processes and conflict resolution, in order to [[recommend effective responses]] at local, national, regional and international levels, and *further requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to make the [[results of this study]] available to the {{Security Council}} and all {{Member States}} of the {{United Nations}};
uncertainties: Whether “recommend effective responses” should be treated as a separate deliverable or as part of the study’s purpose; included here as a deliverable of type recommendations.

text: Also requests the Secretary-General to include in his reports in the context of situations that are on the agenda of the Council the measures taken in the implementation of this resolution, including information on youth in situations of armed conflict and the existence of measures relating to the prevention, partnerships, participation, protection, disengagement and reintegration of youth under this resolution;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Reports on implementation and youth in conflict
Information on youth in armed conflict

textWithHighlights: Also *requests* the <<Secretary-General>> to include in his [[reports]] in the context of situations that are on the agenda of the {{Council}} the measures taken in the implementation of this resolution, including [[information on youth]] in situations of armed conflict and the existence of measures relating to the prevention, partnerships, participation, protection, disengagement and reintegration of youth under this resolution;

text: Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
textWithHighlights: *Decides* to remain actively seized of the matter.
